meanings.definition: A quick and slightly high-pitched sound.
meanings.sent1: I heard a peep coming from the bushes.
meanings.sent2: The chicks made a soft peep as they huddled together.
meanings.sent3: The little bird let out a peep, surprising everyone around.
meanings.sent4: The peep of the microwave signaled that my popcorn was ready.
meanings.sent5: The peep of the alarm clock woke me up in the morning.

meanings.sent1: She tried to peep through the keyhole to see who was outside.
meanings.sent2: The curious cat would often peep through the window at the birds.
meanings.sent3: I couldn't resist peeping at the surprise gift before my birthday.
meanings.sent4: The sun peeped through the clouds after a rainy day.
meanings.sent5: I peeped over the fence to catch a glimpse of the new puppy.

meanings.sent1: The playground was filled with the laughter of little peeps.
meanings.sent2: She carried her peep on her hip as they walked through the park.
meanings.sent3: The little peep ran around the yard, chasing after the butterflies.
meanings.sent4: The tiny peep held onto her mother's hand tightly in the crowded market.
meanings.sent5: The sweet peep giggled as she played with her favorite toy.
